comment: Prof. Schill was hands-down the best Professor I had at KSU. She was always available to return my emails, and even gave out her personal cell phone number (!) so we could talk to her if we needed help. This class made me want to change my major to communications.

Prof Schill took the time to mentor me outside of class. She even called me on a Sunday because I had a last minute question about my project for her class. She really made a difference for me as a student and in other classes as well.
I learned alot from Professor Schill. I feel like these days the kind of info she talks about is important.
Prof. Schill really knows the material and is obviously passionate about it. She definitely cares about us and wants us to do good.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: everything is pretty much spelled out in the syllabus and in the lessons. Quizzes and tests were easy if you used notes, and the project was a breeze. A lot of updates and announcements but I think it helped because it reminded me to turn my stuff in on time. We also got ot watch a interesting variety of Youtube videos that went with the subjects.

I read some bad things on here about this prof but have to say, this semester has not really matched up with it. She will return your emails, the final project is easy and she let us resubmit our papers so we could fix or errors and get a better grade. She gave us study guides for the midterm and final. Cares about her students. Just be organized!!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria

comment: I took Gender, Race and Media online. The material was interesting, but there was A TON of reading. Tests were seriously tough, so have your notes handy! The group project was a joke - so easy. I got a 100 on it. Professor Schill was not my favorite, but she wasn't awful either. I took this class as an elective and there was a lot of work.

Do yourselves a favor and avoid this professor like the plague. She sets unrealistic expectations for her students, creates confusing and unorganized writing prompts, and critiques you if you don't meet up to her expectations perfectly. Instead of directly emailing the student about an issue, she addresses the entire class. Two words: Just Don't.

This teacher needs to be more clear when it comes to assignments. She says one thing and then grades another way.  She is also a very tough grader and I took the class as an elective. She made it extremely hard for no reason and

She is a glorified audio book narrator. All the material in this class could be covered without her as she brings nothing insightful to the table (could do without her  condescending attitude, as well). Schill is not a professor, teacher, educator... at least not a good one. Unclear assignment prompts. Just wait for official teacher evaluations!

Do NOT take her! She is very rude to the class as a whole, as well as personally through email. She expects way too much for an elective and makes the class re-do things over and over because she gives poor instruction the first time. She doesn't work with you at all and when she does, she's rude about it. She has made this this class dreadful.

This professor is  awful. She has an unclear grading criteria. She is always making the class do things over and makes it mandatory for people to go to the writing center. She is rude and rarely responds to emails. She is very sassy. She does not represent what it means to be a professor at KSU. Whatever you do avoid this professor.

Very unclear about what she wants from you, but whatever it is that she wants needs to be 100 percent perfect. Instead of giving good feedback, she addresses the entire class and creates penalty assignments for the mistakes that a few have made. I'm not sure if she wants the class to do well or if she is just impatient and angry.

You better take out extra financial aid for this course. She expects you to buy as many texts for this ONE class as you will buy for all your other COMBINED. Apparently, you are required to be able to come to campus for meetings even though this is an ONLINE course. If you can't attend said meeting, you will be penalized and have to write an essay.

She expects way too much with no direction. So much work for an elective course. She doesn't tell you what she wants until she's already failed you. The discussions are easy but everything else is impossible.

I have to say, I was hopeful about this class and this professor prior to beginning this class, but it has been disappointing. I have seen this professor consistently fail to provide directions for assignments, but then give "clarification". If she would just provide good instructions to begin with, she wouldn't need to clarify. Unorganized.

Schill is a bit unorganized for my liking -- not conducive to success in an online learning environment. Won't settle for mediocre work because she wants you to do well, but doesn't give proper feedback. I wish she would relay information she has learned from experience in her field instead of reading what is listed on a PowerPoint (info in text).

I took her last spring and it was an incredibly easy class. Took our feedback on the readings, some of which were outdated, allowed us to present relevant media objects, pretty simple group work, discussions, and quizzes.
Schill can be a bit difficult. Coursework is easy enough (weekly readingdiscussions, a few easy testsquizzes, a group project, a few papers). Getting an A isn't too hard.
Tough but fair.
